questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: What is ComfyUI-Gemini and what does it offer?
questions.answer: ComfyUI-Gemini integrates Google Gemini into ComfyUI, providing the ability to generate prompts, describe images, and have conversations.

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: What models does Gemini currently offer?
questions.answer: Gemini currently offers two models: Gemini-pro (text model) and Gemini-pro-vision (text + image model).

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: What type of nodes does ComfyUI-Gemini provide?
questions.answer: ComfyUI-Gemini provides two types of nodes: 1) implicit API KEY nodes with Gemini_API_Key set as an environment variable for added security and sharing, and 2) explicit API KEY nodes for personal use that require the API KEY to be entered directly into the node.

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: What are the auxiliary nodes provided by ComfyUI-Gemini?
questions.answer: ComfyUI-Gemini provides two auxiliary nodes: DisplayText_Zho and ConcatText_Zho.

questions.subject: Gemini_pro
questions.question: How does the Gemini-pro model differ from the Gemini-pro-vision model?
questions.answer: The Gemini-pro model does not require an image input, whereas the Gemini-pro-vision model does.

questions.subject: Gemini_pro_vision
questions.question: What can the Gemini-pro-vision model accept as input?
questions.answer: The Gemini-pro-vision model accepts either an image or an image link as input.

questions.subject: Gemini_Zho
questions.question: What capabilities does the Gemini_Zho node have?
questions.answer: The Gemini_Zho node supports both models, with Gemini-pro-vision capable of accepting images as input.

questions.subject: Gemini_Vsion_ImgURL_Zho
questions.question: What type of input does the Gemini_Vsion_ImgURL_Zho node accept?
questions.answer: The Gemini_Vsion_ImgURL_Zho node accepts an image link as input.

questions.subject: Gemini_API_Zho
questions.question: What type of input does the Gemini_API_Zho node support?
questions.answer: The Gemini_API_Zho node supports both models, with Gemini-pro-vision capable of accepting images as input.

questions.subject: Gemini_API_Vsion_ImgURL_Zho
questions.question: What type of input does the Gemini_API_Vsion_ImgURL_Zho node accept?
questions.answer: The Gemini_API_Vsion_ImgURL_Zho node accepts an image link as input.

questions.subject: Gemini_Chat_Zho
questions.question: What features does the Gemini_Chat_Zho node offer?
questions.answer: The Gemini_Chat_Zho node supports the Gemini-pro model with an added context window for a chatbot-like experience.

questions.subject: Gemini_API_Chat_Zho
questions.question: What features does the Gemini_API_Chat_Zho node offer?
questions.answer: The Gemini_API_Chat_Zho node supports the Gemini-pro model with an added context window for a chatbot-like experience.

questions.subject: DisplayText_Zho
questions.question: What does the DisplayText_Zho node do?

questions.subject: ConcatText_Zho
questions.question: What does the ConcatText_Zho node do?
questions.answer: The ConcatText_Zho node concatenates text using a comma (',').

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: How can I request a Gemini_API_Key?
questions.answer: You can request a Gemini_API_Key at the Gemini API website.

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: How do I use the ComfyUI-Gemini nodes?
questions.answer: To use the nodes, you first need to obtain a Gemini_API_Key, then you can either use the implicit nodes by adding the key to the config.json file or use the explicit nodes by entering the key directly into the nodes.

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: How can I install ComfyUI-Gemini?
questions.answer: ComfyUI-Gemini can be installed using the ComfyUI Manager or manually by cloning the repository, navigating to the repository folder, installing the requirements, and restarting ComfyUI.

questions.subject: ComfyUI-Gemini
questions.question: How do the versions of ComfyUI-Gemini differ?
questions.answer: The different versions of ComfyUI-Gemini feature varying nodes, models, and functionalities, with V2.1 adding a new chatbot-like context chat node and fixing a Deadline of 60.0s bug.
